Dave,

Non-integer reaction orders are currently supported for surface 
reaction mechanisms, but not for homogeneous mechanisms.  There is no 
particular difficulty in doing it for homogeneous mechanisms.  I will 
make the appropriate modifications later today and update the CVS 
repository.  I also see that the input file documentation doesn't even 
mention specifying reaction orders, so I'll bring it up to date too 
soon.

As for the specific points you mention:

1) ck2cti doesn't support FORD and RORD;  I'll see if I can easily 
implement it.

2) you're right - currently it will read the reaction orders but ignore 
them for a homogeneous mechanism.

3) Non-unity stoichiometric coefficients should work fine, but this is 
different than specifying reaction orders that do not equal the 
stoichiometric coefficients. If you have a mechanism file where this is 
not working correctly, please send it to me.


Dave



On Jun 16, 2004, at 11:23 AM, E David Huckaby wrote:

> Hello,
>
> Is there a way to introduce arbitrary reaction orders into the
> kinetic rate expressions ?
>
> I tried the following:
>
> 1) using the FORD, RORD auxillary keywords in a chemkin input file and
> using
> ck2cti to convert the reactions.   ck2cti parses the chemkin input file
> but does
> not make in modifications to the description of the reaction in the
> .cti file
>
> 2) manually modify the reaction section of the .cti with the "order"
> keyword.  This
> is read into the Cantera succsesfully but the reaction rate values are
> to small.
>
> I also tried specifying a reaction with non-unity stoichmetric
> coefficients:
> 2 [A] + 3 [B] -> 1 [C] + 4 [D]
> which also seemed to foul up the reaction rate calculations.
>
> Also using non integer stoichmetric coefficients in a chemkin input
> file
> or .cti file is flag as invalid by approriate Cantera utility.
>
> Any suggestions ?
>
> thanks
>
> Dave Huckaby
